meanings.definition: In a lower or lower-ranking position or status compared to something else.
meanings.sent1: The smaller box was placed inferiorly to the larger one.
meanings.sent2: The blue car is inferiorly positioned next to the red one.
meanings.sent3: The tiny puppy felt inferiorly to the big dog, but they soon became friends.
meanings.sent4: The dim light made the room appear inferiorly lit compared to the bright hallway.
meanings.sent5: The old chair looked inferiorly small next to the giant sofa.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is of lower quality or value compared to something else.
meanings.sent1: She sang inferiorly to the other contestants in the competition.
meanings.sent2: The cheaper brand performed inferiorly to the more expensive one.
meanings.sent3: The comedian intentionally told jokes inferiorly to make the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The old computer ran inferiorly to the new model.
meanings.sent5: The student's handwriting was inferiorly neat compared to her classmates.
